title: the red ink
content:
I’ve noted that in certain older style books, headings are printed in red. Is there a term for this kind of treatment where the body text and some headings are bloack, and certain headings are printed in red.  
Thanks.

 [‹ Guardian Re design](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906233022/http:/www.typophile.com/node/15055 "Go to previous forum topic") [Lost in the forest with no memory? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906233022/http:/www.typophile.com/node/15298 "Go to next forum topic")
author: ubergrafik

comments.content: Part of it was, I think red was cheap. Thats what I’ve heard.

A rubric – a heading or text that is emphasised (it stems from _rubrica terra_ Latin for “red earth” which in turn makes red or ochre writing material).  
Tim
